sentences.sContent: He downed his whisky in one swallow.
He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
sentences.sCn: 他喝完最后一口咖啡，要求结账。
开始之前她紧张地咽了一下口水。

sentences.sContent: I found his story a bit hard to swallow (= difficult to believe ) .
sentences.sCn: 我觉得他的说法有点叫人难以置信。

remMethod.val: s+wall(墙)+(l)ow(低的)→燕子在墙角低处筑巢→燕子

trans.tranOther: a small black and white bird that comes to northern countries in the summer
to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach
